transcript:
Weyrother. Weyrother was the Austrian general who had succeeded Schmidt. In the passage little Kozl6vski was squatting on his heels in front of a clerk. The clerk, with cuffs turned up, was hastily writing at a tub turned bottom upwards. Kozlovski's face looked worn he too had evidently not slept all night. He glanced at Prince Andrew and did not even nod to him. 
"Second line . . . have you written it?" he con- tinued dictating to the clerk. "The Kiev Gren- adiers, Podolian . . ." 
"One
